sen.e: The approx. 55% of the polupation of Kyoto Prefecture reside in Kyoto City where the prefectural goverment office is located, and this rate of population concentration is the highest of those of all prefectures in Japan, except Tokyo Prefecture (more specifically Tokyo-to Prefecture (former Tokyo-fu Prefecture) (* when Tokyo Prefecture is included, the rate of Tokyo becomes the highest, with 2/3 of the population of Tokyo Prefecture residing in the special ward area of Tokyo Prefecture (fomer Tokyo City).

sen.j: 京都府は南北に細長く、内陸側に位置し、「山の背」とも表記された南部（旧山城国）と、日本海に面し、丹国（にのくに）と呼ばれた北部（旧丹波国、旧丹後国）との格差が大きく、南部と北部では異なる地域を形成している。
sen.e: With Kyoto prefecture's land shape being long in the north-south direction, the southern inland area (former Yamashiro Province), which is sometimes called a "mountain ridge" area, and the northern area (former Tanba Province and former Tango Province), which is located facing Japan Sea and was once called Ni Province, are markedly different in their natures, generating disparity between the two areas in various aspects.

sen.e: On the other hand, the northern area (including Fukuchiyam City, Maizuru City and Miyazu City), which is sometimes called the Kita Kinki region, is closely related to former Tajima Province (the present northern area of Hyogo Prefecture) and former Wakasa Province (the presentt Reinan area of Fukui Prefecture), but is not so closely related to Kyoto City, comapred with the areas of the two former provinces described above.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後の経済成長において、畿内の一角に当たる旧山城国はいち早く発展したのに対して、北陸地方と山陰地方を結ぶ北部は、日本海側の要衝であるにも拘らず軽視される傾向にあった。
sen.e: In the era after WWII when the Japanese economy growed rapidly, the area of former Yamashiro Province, occupying part of the Kinai region, developed quickly, but the northern area, connecting the Hokuriku region and the Sanin region, was tended to be ignored, though the area is located in an important position on the Japan Sea side.

sen.j: 近年では、旧丹波国にも工業団地が造成され、畿内（大阪市）から丹後（舞鶴市）を経て北陸（敦賀市）を結ぶ舞鶴若狭自動車道が建設されるなど、南北格差の是正が図られている。
sen.e: In recent years, the displarity between the northen and southenr areas has been corrected gradually, for examples, through the construction of industrial parks in the former Tanba Province area and that of Maizuru Wakasa Expressway, which connects the Hokuriku region (Tsuruga City) to the Kinai region (Osaka) via Tango (Maizuru City).
